thread.title: Rugby-Stannard to lead Australia at Comm Games after Holland injured

title: Rugby-Stannard to lead Australia at Comm Games after Holland injured
text: March 20, 2018 / 11:57 PM / Updated an hour ago Rugby - Stannard to lead Australia at Comm Games after Holland injured Reuters Staff 1 Min Read SYDNEY (Reuters) - James Stannard will captain the Australian men’s rugby sevens team at next month’s Commonwealth Games after Lewis Holland was ruled out with a hamstring injury. Rugby Union - HSBC Singapore Sevens - HSBC Sevens World Series - National Stadium, Singapore - 16/4/16 Japan's Teruya Goto (R) is chased by Australia's James Stannard as he runs through to score a try during the pool stage Action Images via Reuters / Jeremy Lee Livepic Holland was named in the squad last week despite awaiting the results of scans after he was injured during the recent World Sevens Series tournament in Vancouver. He has been ruled out of action for two months. Brandon Quinn will replace Holland in the 13-man squad. “It’s obviously hugely disappointing to miss the Commonwealth Games especially one on home soil but I’m still really confident that lads can go all the way and win gold,” Holland said in a statement on Wednesday. “I’ll do everything I can now to help the boys so I’m fine with filling up the water bottles or helping carry the bags.” The men’s tournament will be held on the final two days of the April 4-15 Games on the Gold Coast, with Australia drawn in Pool B with Samoa, Jamaica and England. Reporting by Greg Stutchbury;
